metadata.dc:author: Pimentel, T
Fernández, D
Toraño, I
Rodriguez, C
Ribas Antúnez, M A
metadata.dc:description: An evaluation of a Dot ELISA made by the Center of Genetic Engineering and Biotechnology for detecting Rotavirus antigen, was carried out. 100 feces samples were analyzed by this technique and the results were compared with those obtained with polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis, technique traditionally used in the Rotavirus diagnosis. It was obtained a high coincidence, specificity and sensitivity among them.
metadata.dc:title: Evaluación de un Dot ELISA para la detección de antígeno de Rotavirus.
[Evaluation of a Dot ELISA for the detection of a Rotavirus antigen].
